How many times do I have to read this from a user's comment:

"OMG!! My anti-virus program says this torrent contains a trojan/key-logger!!!"

The people who post those comments are either nimrods, or are in the employ of the software vendor for the product in question.

For the last time: Most, if not all, anti-virus software flags key generator behavior as malware. Why do they do this? To frighten you into paying for what you are trying to get for free.

Is it possible that a key-generator is a REAL virus? Yes it is. But I've been using these things for years, and I've yet to find ONE bonified threat introduced to my system as a result of using these patcher/key-generators.

You must add patchers and key-generators as trusted files in your anti-virus software so that they will not be quarantined in order to get them to work.

If you are suspicious? Use Sandboxie sandbox software with virtual file system and registries to inspect the EXACT changes the software will make to your machine, and then decide for yourself based on data, instead of supposition, whether or not to let the program make the changes that it want's to make.

After patching executable files, scan the patched executable for viruses, and not the patch software itself.

Even if a key-generator DOES introduce malware to your system, your anti-virus software will be watching, and will flag further behavior as a result of whatever got through the first time. If it does not... then you are using a substandard anti-virus software/firewall combination, and key-generators are the LEAST of your problems.

Relying on the comments posted by a few to sway your judgement is never a good idea. Study up. Learn your anti-virus/firewall software INSIDE & OUT.

There is no substitute for having a solid system in place.

I have used this key generator in my sandbox. This software made NO changes to my system.

All it did, was display a serial number for me to copy.

I have used tam/CORE key-generators many times. I have never found one that ACTUALLY contained a virus.

Don't believe it?  Get Sandboxie software... LEARN HOW TO USE IT, and see for yourself.
